alert.note: Alert for Lake; Orange; Seminole; Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 6:53AM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following counties, Lake, Orange, Seminole and Volusia. * WHEN...Until 845 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 652 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Deltona, Sanford, Apopka, Altamonte Springs, Ocoee, Winter Garden, Lake Mary, Longwood, Mount Dora, Orange City, Mount Plymouth, Zellwood, Lake Apopka, DeBary, Ferndale, Clermont, Oakland, Wekiwa Springs State Park, Wekiva Springs and Forest City. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
